metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6647 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free in AnimationController::endAnimationUpdate in Google Chrome.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Notes in the bug suggests it never affected released versions

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
